page.title: 01CULMSTOCK LAND AND BUILDINGS
page.content: CULMSTOCK is 'the stock farm on the Culm' to translate its Saxon name and this area is covered by grassland, cultivated fields, moorland, heath and deciduous trees. The Blackdown Hills form the north-eastern boundary of the village and the foothill BLACKDOWN COMMON is designated an area of outstanding natural beauty and is one of the last wetlands in Devon. The south-west point is called CULMSTOCK BEACON, on which stands a unique BEEHIVE BEACON HUT. There are over 20 FARMS and 2 COUNCIL HOUSING ESTATES, with 35 and 8 houses respectively and a PRIVATE ESTATE of 23 houses. An underground RESERVOIR, a School, Baptist Church, Racing and Riding Stables, Public and Private Playing Fields, part of M5 Motorway and one bus a week serves the area.
